alert.note: Alert for Lee; Magoffin (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 1:13PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Morgan, northwestern Breathitt, west central Magoffin, northeastern Lee and Wolfe Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 112 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Grannie, or near Campton, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Lane, Hollonville, Bethany, Pence and Calaboose around 120 PM EDT. Landsaw, Malaga, Baptist, Stillwater, Paxton, Trent, Wilhurst, Gosneyville, Vancleve and Sewell around 125 PM EDT. Simpson, Lexie, Gilmore, Upper Gilmore, Hazel Green, Moct, Toliver, Murphyfork and Taulbee around 130 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Helechawa, Lee City, Adele, Lower Gilmore, Sellars, Belknap, Daysboro, Rosefork, Shockey, Burkhart, Cannel City, Caney, Payton, Burg, Netty, Wheel Rim, Cutuno, Lizzielane, Nickell and Panama. THIS INCLUDES Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 40 and 65. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for southeastern and east central Kentucky.
